newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - May 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - May 7.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
- Jiang Zemin urges all Chinese to study the Basic Law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

- The National People's Congress convenes session to review 12 laws, international conventions and treaties. Laws on government supervision and blood donation will be voted upon at the end of the four-day session.
- Starting this year, the central government will add 1.5 billion yuan every year to the national drive to help poverty-stricken people.
- China plans to gradually remove restrictions on 385 categories of imports after gaining entry into the World Trade Organisation.
- China becomes the third largest ship-building country in the world with an ouput capacity of 1.9 million tonnes in 1996.
- The Civil Aviation Administration of China says China's air transport grew by an average 20.9 percent a year over the last 16 years.
- Foreign Ministry spokesman Shen Guofang strongly protests the landing by a Japanese parliamentarian on a group of disputed islands in the East China Sea.
- China is considering allowing large state-owned companies to issue bonds on international markets.
